intro: Hemipilia × mixta, commonly known as the hybrid orchid, is a naturally occurring hybrid between Hemipilia heterophylla and Hemipilia tsoi. It is a terrestrial orchid characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and green, typical of the Orchidaceae family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions of China. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
